Reviews.Title: Product works well, but research it at Dyle.tv first!
Reviews.Author: Roger Keating
Reviews.Content: Just got the Audiovox MobileTV tuner and have used it in a taxi, sitting in Central Park (I live in NYC) and from my apartment and it works great -- I get both NBC, Fox, Qubo for the kids and Telemundo (which doesnt help me since I dont speak Spanish).  Definitely look up the coverage area at Dyle.tv before buying this product to see what channels are available where you live because not all broadcast stations send their signal through Dyle.  Also, if you couldn't get TV with rabbit ears, this won't work for you either -- the signal is being picked up from the station's broadcast tower, not through the cellular network.  That said, I can fire it up, throw it on my window sill and watch live TV  from my iPad anywhere in my apartment without racking up data charges.  Just gotta do some research first at Dyle.tv.  Happy TV viewing!

Reviews.Title: The Fine Print
Reviews.Author: ManOfManyInterests
Reviews.Content: This product works as advertised if you use a later generation tablet or cell phone. It did not work with an IPad 1 but it did work with an IPad 3 and with a Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 7 inch model. It also worked well with my Samsung Galaxy Note II cell phone.  There are 5 stations available in my area that are accessible with the Dyle box. All of them gave a crystal clear picture most of the time no matter what part of the metro area I tested them except for one station that worked 80% of the time. (I live in suburban Cincinnati)You are probably thinking why did this guy give the thing 3 stars if it worked as well as he said it did? I'll tell you what they are not telling you based on my personal experience. Dyle TV does not have broadcasting rights to rebroadcast NFL football. I tried to watch 3 different games the weekend that I had it. All of them were blacked out. One channel broadcasted their alternative weather channel during the game. The other channel had a static banner up the entire game stating that Dyle TV did not have rebroadcasting rights. One channel did broadcast pregame highlights but the picture became very pixelated every time they showed game highlights. I also heard on my local news station that the Dyle TV service is currently free but they (Dyle) reserve the rights to charge for the service in the future. Perhaps someone from Dyle can comment on this.I would guess that the native resolution of Dyle TV is something around 640 x 360 pixels. This means that the signal is less than high definition which would have to be at least 1280 X 720 to be 720p. There is a picture resize tool in their application which allows you to view channels in their native resolution. The native resolution on some channels yielded a picture that was about 1/8 the size of my cell phone which is tiny. I would expect that the thing would be able to rebroadcast in high definition on a phone or tablet that has the capability to replay a signal in 1080p.I'm not trying to badmouth or bash this product. It does work and it is watchable. The picture stayed almost perfectly synced with the sound all the time. It works as advertised. My deal breakers were the lack of high definition and no NFL rebroadcast on Sundays which were enough for me to send it back. It is also too expensive in my opinion. I can buy a RCA DPTM70R 7-Inch 60Hz TV right here on Amazon for $15 less than this unit and have a 7 inch TV that will get all the broadcast NFL games in my area and I don't have to worry about the battery on my phone running down. I will also get many more channels with the RCA TV vs. Dyle. The RCA will receive all of the broadcast stations in my area. (44 channels) The Dyle unit only gets 5. From what I understand, my area has more Dyle stations than most so you should check to see what you are going to get before you buy this. Don't assume you will get all of the stations in your area because you won't.Also beware that the audiovox unit is about the size of half a pack of cigarettes if you would cut it in half top to bottom. I would think that it would be very easy to loose. I would suggest to Audiovox that they put some sort of thingy on the box so you can attach it to a lanyard or a key ring so you don't loose the thing.

Reviews.Title: Works Great!
Reviews.Author: SW Florida Info Tech
Reviews.Content: Works as advertised.  I can watch 3 local stations in the Tampa Bay area.I've tried it on an iPad (3rd generation) running iOS 7, iPhone 4s running iOS 6and iPhone 5s (of course running iOS 7).Note that you need to be sure to download the correct app: search for 'Siano' in the iTunes app store.  If you download the wrong app, you will get 'Receiver Not Detected' error message.

Reviews.Title: limited ststions
Reviews.Author: djbigd
Reviews.Content: this is a great product but it is very limited when it comes to station choices.the website said i was going to get 4 station well i only get 3 now. also i was watching my tv at home and wanted to watch the game well the station would not watch the game it transfered to alternate programming on another sub channel

Reviews.Title: Siano -download Dyle TV by Siano for iPad
Reviews.Author: Patrick J. Doyle
Reviews.Content: Works perfectly. But download the app by Siano for Dyle TV. It will be gray and orange. The blue Dyle TV does not work with iPad even though both are in the App Store. Started with the wrong one and wanted to smash the audiovox unit against the wall. It is not even in the directions when you get the unit, but there is a picture in the literature. Deleted the blue icon and downloaded the grey orange one and "zap" it worked flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: works as advertised, but poor quality
Reviews.Author: Ed O.
Reviews.Content: I was excited at first to see this receiver, because finally you don't have to be attached to your 30 pin connector to use this receiver as in previous mobile tv receivers, and you could also use it on Android devices. I tested this product on an Ipad 4 and Droid Razr Maxx HD Android smartphone and it works on both devices. You must download the proper app to use it (Dyle mobile TV app by Siano). Note: When you connect with the receiver from the settings on the Ipad you will not see the Wi-Fi connected symbol in the notification bar on top. I was able to test it in two different markets, in Phoenix and Charlotte. Both markets had five stations that you were able to pick up. However, one of the reasons I got this product was to watch NFL games on CBS and NBC on Sundays, but the channel would not broadcast the game, only an alternate HD channel was shown. According to other reviews, it is an issue of rights between the NFL and Dyle TV. I hope that this issue will be resolved, since it would be nice to watch NFL playoffs and the Super Bowl on your mobile device. I hope that someone from Dyle TV could comment on this and see if this would ever happen.When you do view a channel in the app, the screen is mediocre at best. (I do have an over the air HDTV antenna at home (no cable), which the picture comes in high definition and really clear.) On the Ipad you can see the channel, but it gets pixelated at times and no where near the quality of the picture of my regular TV that receives regular HDTV signals. I understand that this is due to the mobile tv signal from Dyle not broadcast in HD, but at a lower resolution to accommodate all mobile devices. It's too bad, because it would be nice to see the Dyle tv signal in full HD in a Retina display or an HD display like on my Razr. (You could also pause the live tv up to 15 minutes, which is convenient.)Also, since this unit has a built in hotspot and you must connect to it in your wifi settings, you cannot also access the internet at the same time that you are using this app and receiver. What this app needs to do is be able to access this receiver and another wifi hotspot with internet at the same time. It could be something similar to Seagate's Wireless Plus hard drive and app, which lets you do both at the same time (and lets you connect more than one mobile device to it). It seems like an app issue, so maybe in future updates Siano can make this happen in their app. Also, I was disappointed in the fact that only one device can use this receiver at the same time. Maybe that can also be changed in future app updates also.I will be returning this item just because of the NFL games issue.

Reviews.Title: QR code on box may be misleading.
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth J. Groenewegen "Jacky"
Reviews.Content: I had purchased it wihout knowing about needing to scan the QR code on the box to determine if you will have channels in my area. So when it came, I then did the scan. It said no channels. I proceeded anyway and 4 were available. It's a great little device! Loved watching on my iPad.

Reviews.Title: Free TV anywhere any time on your I-Phone or I-Pad  with no data plan
Reviews.Author: Jay Adrick
Reviews.Content: Excellent reception from the local TV stations when paired with my I-Phone or my I-Pad.  The reception in the car when mobile is also very good. I now carry the device with me when I travel to other cities as the Dyle service and other stations are on the air in more than 50 cities. This is free TV with no data plan and reliance on Wi-Fi services.

Reviews.Title: The best out there
Reviews.Author: Jay Nix
Reviews.Content: I have tried all the mobile devices.  This by far exceeds them.  Picks up weaker signals, and you can watch while it's charging.  The other units did not have power feed through capability, so I could not externally power the iPad when watching.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Product
Reviews.Author: Steve Nixon
Reviews.Content: Have been looking for a product to watch TV in a moving car, works like a charm.  Makes TVs out of all my Iphone, Ipad devices for 100 bucks.  Live in a rural area, coverage map said I wouldn't receive reception till I got closer to metro area, but to my surprise I got reception imediately where I live.

Reviews.Title: Audio vox mobile tv dyle tv
Reviews.Author: Dale Smith
Reviews.Content: I am satisfied with this product, but there are a couple of points: 1. If you use an iPad you must get the silano app from App Store otherwise it will not work . In Detroit area there are 4 free channels as of this date and different generation iPads May not get them all my iPad 3 only got 3. iPad air got all 4. . Signal is affected by weather, distance, and amount of electronics in room. Some of the stations here do broadcast mobile tv in HD. Sometimes 720p some time 1080p when it happens it look great on retina but it depends on signal and iPad power both have to be great. I was able to get some nfl games, but black out rules are different for Mobil TV and it seems to be up to nfl, and local station if they wish to put games on mobile. Sunday NBC did Fox did not.In conclusion please check coverage area before you purchase, and check if your local stations even broadcast a Mobil signal. For sports check blackout rules for mobile. This is what free tv was like in 70's people  I hope they add more channels.

Reviews.Title: dyletv
Reviews.Author: joan feeney
Reviews.Content: Couldn't get it to come on. Did not fulfill what I was expecting. I received no instruction book with it--so I just had to "wing" it.

Reviews.Title: Mobile TV
Reviews.Author: Hm Rosenfeld
Reviews.Content: Works nice, would be better if it had a larger selection of stations. Make sure you download the correct app. I found out the hard way. Now, it's up and running, hooooray.

Reviews.Title: Tiny
Reviews.Author: Z. Norman "ZoeD'Eau"
Reviews.Content: Small but powerful with limited viewing areas. Android has pause feature.Easy installation and access. Limited viewing in outlying areas is the only minus I've found.

Reviews.Title: Really cool, really works!
Reviews.Author: J. M. Mundy "over the hill cat guy"
Reviews.Content: I love it! My only beef if any, is that its resolution is really low, but besides that I get five channels where I live. Like I said, I love this thing! Its so tiny you can easily loose it but it creates a mini WiFi and connects to your device quickly. The app you download is very basic but efficient.

Reviews.Title: Audiovox receiver for Dyle TV
Reviews.Author: S. Egerton "Kimsea"
Reviews.Content: I recently lost power in my home due to bad weather.  I had read about Dyle TV and thought it would be so nice to be able to still get live weather reports as I felt so cut off!  I immediately ordered this receiver and I am very impressed with it.  All I need now is to make sure I have power back-up for my tablet and smart phone and I will not be cut off again!  Setting up the receiver and activating was really easy.  I thoroughly recommend this product.  At the moment Dyle TV is free but I have read that there may be a charge in the future.  If there is, I do hope it is reasonable!

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Christopher Richards "Richardsaz"
Reviews.Content: Have been using this product for about an hour and so far it has worked as a champ! other review were accurate..  its SD resolution and works just like an antennae

Reviews.Title: Fantastic mobile TV tuner.
Reviews.Author: JC
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the best purchases I've ever made as an add on to my smart device. What's really makes this device a winner is that the tuner has its own wifi to transmit the TV signals it picks up over the air, so in doors you can set it by a window and it will still transmit a perfect picture to your phone or tablet upto 30 feet way from it, and even in another room through walls. Outside it gets signals great, same with holding it in your hand or putting it in your pocket while walking, also works very well in a vehicle including traveling at highway speed. The icing on the cake is the ability to pause and rewind live television just like a DVR.  The battery lasts very long and can be recharged while in use. Easy to set up, easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Works great,
Reviews.Author: P. Stimler
Reviews.Content: Fills the bill!  I use it with my iPad.  Easy to set up.  Appears to have a timer, but haven't figured out how to use it.

Reviews.Title: This works so well!
Reviews.Author: Dee Garza
Reviews.Content: When I first received it I had a house guest and gave her my room with a TV.  I took the guest room.  I had tried watching shows on the computer in there, but grew impatient with the buffering, etc.  But with this little gadget I was able to watch real, live tv with excellent results!  The picture was so very good and so was the sound.  I got my local NBC, CBS, FOX and Telemundo stations.  Haven't checked to see if more have been added, but I'm very happy with it.Then I took it to work.  The instructions say to put the unit by a window.  At work the nearest window is a small one at least 50 feet away.  That wouldn't have worked, so I set it right outside my office, far from the window (at least 50 feet), and went into the office and tried watching tv on my phone.  It worked, and worked well.I would recommend this to anybody.  Can't wait until more station are added.  Just be sure you download the correct app for this device, since they are not all the same.This would come in handy with power failures, such as during a hurricane.  Also would work when cable is out.  It's great for travel, too.  I live in a large city so I don't know how this would work out in the boonies, but I love using it here.

Reviews.Title: Decent Antenna
Reviews.Author: GCarroll
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't use this if your way out from the transmission tower. Must be in clear line of site (higher ground) to the transmission source to get good channels. When it does receive the signal it is relatively clear picture.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Rog
Reviews.Content: Do not waist your money. Not many stations are part of the Dyle network. I have traveled from Atlanta to NY to Dallas and scanned as I arrived in each market and maybe I get 1 or two stations. Also the Dyle app DOES NOT WORK on any of my mobile phone devices (apple android) nor does it work on my ipad. There are 3rd party Dyle apps that do work that you can search in the app store.

Reviews.Title: Dyle Mobile Tv
Reviews.Author: Mr.L
Reviews.Content: Will not stay connected for more then 5 min. When it dose connectNo i will not recommend to anyoneA big Waste of money for meI have a band new  LG Optimus F7 smartphoneSorry a great ideal but not working right

Reviews.Title: Best investment
Reviews.Author: Mr Albert Cisneros
Reviews.Content: I take it to work, no problems receiving local channels.  It doesn't work on laptops. Make sure your city supports Dyle mobile

Reviews.Title: Audiovox receiver
Reviews.Author: BRIAN R.
Reviews.Content: Pretty sensitive to get reception on more than a couple local channels but if you have no other source of reception It's nice to have because you can use it anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Does what it supposed to do
Reviews.Author: RSK "Consumer"
Reviews.Content: Works as advertised. Only 4 of the local stations are on the service right now. but I am sure more will follow. Nice to be able to sit anywhere in the house or yard and dial up a local station on my Nexus.Will not work on my phone. App will not download. (not new enough I Guess)

Reviews.Title: Barely worth the money
Reviews.Author: Dean Allen
Reviews.Content: We live 8 miles from Kansas City, Mo. in Liberty, Mo. According to website, we should be able to get 4 channels. The best we have been able to get is TWO.  To be absolutely fair, I took the unit to the highest point overlooking the Kansas City, Mo downtown area (less than 2 miles away, and line of sight) and still the unit could get no more than TWO of the channels which should be available. At times, the unit can only get reception on ONE channel. I use this unit in conjunction with my Samsung Galaxy S3 which is less than 3 months old. We bought two of these units at the same time--one for me, and one for my wife, who has the same cellphone. The problems are the same for both phones and receivers. The ONLY advantage this offers is the capability of receiving live TV during a power outage, since it is not dependent on wall current. The furthest we have been is 8 miles from the television stations transmitting antennae. Both television stations KCTV 5 ( CBS) and KMBC channel 9 ( ABC) have power outputs of 1,000 KW. The other two television stations are KSHB (NBC) Channel 41, and KCPT (PBS), neither of which we can get on the Audiovox units. PBS KCPT is the lowest power output of the bunch at 450 kw.  Not very good in my estimation.

Reviews.Title: Mobile TV antennae
Reviews.Author: Kaye M. Palmer-Dilworth
Reviews.Content: Wow, this antennae is so cool. Now I can watch some of may favorite shows no matter where I am.

Reviews.Title: Audiovos mobiletv receiver
Reviews.Author: Claudia M. Young
Reviews.Content: So far, it is exactly what I wanted.  Will be taking it on the road with me soon and I can really test it out.

Reviews.Title: one hundred dollar piece of junk
Reviews.Author: corey gilbert
Reviews.Content: this thing only picked up three channels no matter where I tried to use it. I have a five year old portable tv that picks up over twenty five channels, and this is supposed to be new breaking edge technology. the makers of this device are laughing all the way to the bank on the people that shelled out there hard earned money for this piece of crap

Reviews.Title: prob need to save your monwy
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: Just got my receiver today,took forever to get it to link to my phone. When it did i got one spanish channel and one local. I have a antenna that was on my semi that pulls in six channels. Keep in mind im near alliance tx.so it may be great for metropolitan use idk. Have to say it is much smaller than expected.

Reviews.Title: Check coverage area you are in before ordering
Reviews.Author: johnnycake62
Reviews.Content: I lived in an area too far from the broadcast signal source to receive a signal.  Really disappointing.  I had high hopes.

Reviews.Title: negative stars if I could.
Reviews.Author: paul sylvester
Reviews.Content: Works good for a few weeks, follewed by problems on top of problems. The only thing that will make it better is to get my money back, please inform me on how to do that. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised but the selection is very limited.
Reviews.Author: Steven M. Mcmahon "deal hunter"
Reviews.Content: It does what it says although what it does is limited. You will be able to get television with this however it's limited to a handful of stations at best in anyone area. Really I think that most people will be better off converting a DVD to video and transferring it to your iPad. However if you do feel the necessity to watch 12 or three channels of live television on your iPad this is the device with which to do it. I would rather see you device the axes and antenna and has a corresponding app to allow you to get any channel with which you can receive a signal

Reviews.Title: Scrambled statinon in areas
Reviews.Author: Rich anders
Reviews.Content: still lots of scrambled stations/areas i get one channel in atlanta but not in ft lauderdale.  but sure in time this will happen soon

Reviews.Title: Great idea just did not work out
Reviews.Author: Bruno Bear2 "Bruno Bear2"
Reviews.Content: The Audio box would not work in San Tan Valley, AZ I'm not sure why if didn't work but maybe there were not enough cell towers.

Reviews.Title: It works
Reviews.Author: Vicki Bowman "vb1066"
Reviews.Content: This Audiovox receiver does work wonderfully it you are in range of the stations towers.  Outside the range it does not work, which is my problem.  But great if you are traveling.

Reviews.Title: Receives Four channels only !
Reviews.Author: o c
Reviews.Content: Receives only Four channels only !If this is acceptable , but it.Product does work with 720P broadcast reception.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality poor value
Reviews.Author: lou kelly
Reviews.Content: Very few channels poor service hit n missWould not waste the money now on sale prob why slow sales

Reviews.Title: Pocket television
Reviews.Author: William Montanez
Reviews.Content: Great product and very compact.. I would recommend if you don't want to purchase a tv or antenna.. Very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: Great for tablet/phone
Reviews.Author: Ted Hand
Reviews.Content: Works as advestised  Good range.  Great for tablet/phone.  Be careful with antenna. External antenna connection would be nice.  Would buy more if needed

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this product!
Reviews.Author: Raul Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: This product did not worked as advertised and Audiobox technical supports is pitiful!I tested this product on the following devices:IPad 4, running latest release of IOS7Phone 5, running latest release of IOS 7IPhone 4S, running latest release of IOS 6IPAD 2, running latest release of IOS 6Droid Razor running Andriod 4.1.2IT FAILED ON ALL DEVICES!All of these devices and operating systems are supposed to be compatible with this device per the System Requirements documentation.I keep getting an error message that says Receiver Not Detected. The symptoms that I am getting for IOS is that when I select the Audiovox Wi-FI signal, Wi-FI symbol on the top left of the screen never changes to Wi-FI symbol. It stays as AT&T; LTE.On top of this, I opened a ticket with Audiobox Technial support and after giving them detail information about the problem, I get this response from a Trudy Holden.Discussion Thread---------------------------------------------------------------Response Via Email(Trudy Holden) - 11/04/2013 10:21 AMDear Raul,This device requires a ATSC-MH receiver/tuner chipset. Does your device have this?Thank you for using Audiovox Electronics.Trudy, Customer Service------------------------------------------------------If technical support can not read the product specifications and technical requirements of this product, they do not reserve my business!Raul Gonzalez

Reviews.Title: Could not charge
Reviews.Author: Mass Shopper
Reviews.Content: Did not work for us.  Charge light did not work.  Tried anyway.  Connected to wifi but nothing else would work.  Very poor instructions for set up and problem-solving.

Reviews.Title: works ok but for money get other stuff
Reviews.Author: Coach Tom
Reviews.Content: works OK but way too pricey.. takes several attemps to conect.. not every device can connect same time. go w something else out there.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: yohey33319
Reviews.Content: It Had a very difficult time tuning into broadcast stations - The stations changed every time the device was refreshed - it was never capable of accumulating more than six or seven stations - surprisingly, most of them were not network stations

Reviews.Title: Dyle TV Review
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: devise works great IF it is strategically placed near a window.  if signal is shielded in any way, picture, or picture quality is less.  to the contrary, I have enjoyed it when I observe the foregoing cautions.  I like it.  JB

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: bonita howard
Reviews.Content: Total waste of money.  Only picks up one channel.  I really like the size but it does not provide the service as advertised.

Reviews.Title: Dyle mobile TV
Reviews.Author: John F. Duckett
Reviews.Content: We can't get the local Fox network CH46, which is why I wanted it in the first place. We can get three of the other four channels in the area.Not happy!

Reviews.Title: Poor signal reception.  Only pick up 2 to 3 stations where there are hundreds
Reviews.Author: Constructore
Reviews.Content: Needed tv by the kitchen and could not get reception there.  It knocks off the wifi for internet use on iPad. So it's either on or the other.

Reviews.Title: no service
Reviews.Author: wendy
Reviews.Content: Onpy cathes 3 channels n 1 is n spanish.. also i bought it for work n it will not get any stations in deer park texas..

Reviews.Title: Product only works in large cities
Reviews.Author: SteveC
Reviews.Content: This product does not work in my city area. You must live near a large city area where there are TV transmitters nearby.

Reviews.Title: piece of sh it
Reviews.Author: thuong pham
Reviews.Content: No signal. ..at all my portable rca tv have 10 ch good sigal..I got for $45.00 i got on ebay so ..audiovox mobile tv no good

Reviews.Title: Does not work!
Reviews.Author: tyler
Reviews.Content: Said my area got 5 stations 2 were the the same. Picture was choppy and distorted. Dont waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Look b4 u leap
Reviews.Author: Erica
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the hype.  After research, I wouldn't dare spend my money on this.  Thank God for the internet. So easy to get information.

Reviews.Title: I was pleased to be able to purchase it.
Reviews.Author: Martha
Reviews.Content: The individual I gave it to has not as of yet used it to I really don't know if they are happy with it yet.

ProductInfo.Features:
Works on Kindle, Apple (iOS) and Android devices
No data plan or internet necessary to operate and covers over 130 stations nationwide
Free, easy-to-use Audiovox mobiletv with Dyle TV App
View high-quality digital TV (ATSC-M/H)
Confirm if coverage exists in your area here: http://dyle.tv/coverage-map/
ProductInfo.Name: Audiovox mobiletv Receiver with Dyle mobile TV (WIDTV1), White, in select markets
